channel.title: AI Timeline
channel.description: Daily updates from the AI world. Models, labs, and breakthroughs.

item.title: OpenAI Acquires Torch for ~$60M
item.description: OpenAI acquired healthcare technology startup Torch for approximately $60 million. Expansion into healthcare AI.

item.title: OpenAI Retiring GPT-4o, GPT-4.1 Models
item.description: OpenAI retiring GPT-4o, GPT-4.1, GPT-4.1 mini, and o4-mini from ChatGPT on February 13th, 2026. Consolidation toward newer models.

item.title: Apple Partners with Google for Gemini-Powered Siri
item.description: Apple launching Gemini AI-powered Siri in February 2026 with iOS 26.4. Major shift in Apple's AI strategy, leveraging Google's model for more intelligent, context-aware voice assistant.

item.title: Anthropic-Google Cloud Partnership: 1 Million TPUs by 2026
item.description: Anthropic announced cloud partnership with Google, gaining access to up to one million custom TPUs. Partnership will bring more than one gigawatt of AI compute capacity online by 2026.

item.title: Anthropic CEO Warns: AI Could Be Misused for Biological Weapons
item.description: Dario Amodei warned AI may soon be 'better than humans at almost everything.' The comments highlight growing concerns about frontier AI safety and potential misuse.

item.title: Tesla Invests $2B in xAI
item.description: Tesla invested $2 billion in Elon Musk's AI startup xAI as part of a broader $20 billion funding round. The transaction formalizes a symbiotic intelligence layer, embedding Grok's reasoning into Tesla's physical hardware. Marks a deeper shift toward AI and robotics as Tesla faces falling EV sales.

item.title: Arcee Unveils 400B Open LLM Trinity
item.description: Tiny startup Arcee AI released Trinity 400B, a sparse Mixture-of-Experts model activating 13B parameters, built from scratch for $20M. Apache-licensed model aims to rival Meta's Llama 4 Maverick on coding, math, and reasoning benchmarks. Trained in six months, targeting developers seeking a permanently open U.S.-based alternative.

item.title: Moltbot (Clawdbot) Goes Viral
item.description: Personal AI assistant Moltbot (formerly Clawdbot) went viral after promising to 'actually do things.' Built by Austrian developer Peter Steinberger, the open-source project attracted 44,200 GitHub stars within weeks. Anthropic legal challenge forced name change. Cloudflare stock rose 14% premarket on buzz. Experts warn security risks.

item.title: Google Chrome Adds Agentic AI Features
item.description: Google is rolling out deeper Gemini integration in Chrome with a persistent AI sidebar and early agentic features. The assistant can understand groups of tabs, answer questions about browsing context, and integrates 'Personal Intelligence' to synthesize Gmail, Calendar, and Photos data for autonomous task execution.

item.title: Amazon Cuts 16,000 Jobs Amid AI Push
item.description: Amazon announced fresh layoffs to reduce bureaucracy as it competes with Microsoft and Google in AI. About 9% of staff trimmed. The cuts come as the company accelerates AI investment.

item.title: Waabi Raises $1B for Robotaxis
item.description: Autonomous trucking startup Waabi closed a $1 billion Series C to expand into robotaxis, intensifying competition in self-driving mobility.

item.title: Robots Can Now See Through Glass
item.description: Researchers tested LingBot-Depth, an AI depth system helping robots handle reflective and transparent objects where normal cameras fail. Success rates jumped sharply in real-world trials. The system worked in mirror-filled gyms and glass lobbies using cheap consumer cameras, making previously impossible tasks achievable.

item.title: Microsoft Crashes 12% on AI CapEx Concerns
item.description: Microsoft shares suffered worst drop since 2020 after reporting $37.5B quarterly AI CapEx (up 66% YoY) while Azure growth slowed to 39%. The market is punishing 'blind spending' on AI infrastructure, triggering sector-wide sell-off. Analysts point to 'DeepSeek Shock' as root cause - efficient Chinese models making $100B+ data center build-outs look like over-provisioning.

item.title: Nvidia Under US Scrutiny for Allegedly Helping DeepSeek
item.description: Reports confirm Nvidia is under fresh US scrutiny for 'supporting' Chinese AI efficiency. According to NVIDIA records, Nvidia personnel helped DeepSeek achieve major training efficiency gains through 'optimized co-design of algorithms, frameworks, and hardware.' DeepSeek-V3 requires only 2.788M H800 GPU hours for full training - less than what U.S. developers typically require for frontier-scale models.

item.title: Pentagon Clashes with Anthropic Over Military AI Safeguards
item.description: The Pentagon is at odds with Anthropic over safeguards that would prevent the government from deploying its technology to target weapons autonomously. The dispute highlights growing tensions between AI companies and military applications.

item.title: Anthropic CEO Warns: 'The Adolescence of Technology'
item.description: Dario Amodei publishes 19,000-word essay warning humanity is entering a 'rite of passage' that will 'test who we are as a species'. States powerful AI systems could be 1-2 years away and the world is 'considerably closer to real danger' than in 2023.

item.title: OpenAI Introduces Prism for Scientific Research
item.description: New LaTeX-native workspace designed to assist scientists with research and writing. Targets academic users needing sophisticated document preparation alongside AI assistance.

item.title: Model Context Protocol Gains Major Adoption
item.description: MCP sees rapid uptake by OpenAI, Google DeepMind, and toolmakers like Zed and Sourcegraph. Protocol addresses growing demand for contextually-aware AI agents capable of pulling from diverse sources.

item.title: Anthropic Internal Conflict: Safety vs Speed
item.description: The Atlantic reports on tensions within Anthropic between safety researchers and pressure to ship products faster. Safety researcher Sam Bowman: 'Things are moving uncomfortably fast.'

item.title: Apple Developing AI Smart Glasses for 2026 Launch
item.description: Apple working on smart glasses to rival Meta's AI Ray-Bans. Features include cameras, speakers, sensors, and AI integration, but no displays. Potential launch in 2026-2027 timeframe.

item.title: Kimi K2.5 Released
item.description: New coding-focused model with 256K context window and improved tool use capabilities. Features enhanced reasoning for complex engineering tasks.

item.title: Anthropic Research: Constitutional AI v2
item.description: Updated framework for AI alignment showing 40% improvement in safety benchmarks while maintaining performance on standard tasks.

item.title: Google DeepMind: New Multimodal Architecture
item.description: Unified model processes text, image, audio, and video in single forward pass. Claims 3x efficiency improvement over separate pipelines.

item.title: OpenAI GPT-4.5 Research Preview
item.description: Limited preview launched for enterprise customers. Focuses on improved coding accuracy and longer context coherence.

item.title: Stability AI Open Sources New Image Model
item.description: SD-XL 2.0 released with improved text rendering and composition. Apache 2.0 license.
